title: WTM calls on industry to send in responsible tourism case studies
text:
WTM calls on industry to send in responsible tourism case studies 3 July 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
Industry case studies are being sought by World Travel Market, as it works on a white paper on carbon reduction within the travel industry. 
The white paper, which will draw on best-practice examples, will demonstrate it is possible for travel companies to reduce their carbon emissions while also seeing significant cost savings. 
It is part of WTM’s World Responsible Tourism Day’s focus on carbon reduction and will pre-empt the United Nations Climate Change Conference in Paris at the end of November. The conference is aiming to achieve the first legally binding climate change agreement in 20 years. 
WTM senior director Simon Press said: “At WRTD we have been promoting the business case behind responsible tourism for many years now and we know there are many great examples of best practice within the industry. 
“By pooling our knowledge in this report we can not only help people attending the day’s event but also, hopefully, the entire industry.” 
The afternoon sees a debate on whether the industry can reduce its carbon emissions. 
To get involved with the white paper, email WTM responsible tourism consultant Professor Harold Godwin at harold@haroldgoodwin.info with examples of carbon reduction case studies.
